CWEs: CWE-601: URL Redirection to Untrusted Site ('Open Redirect')
CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
description: The function is vulnerable to Open Redirect, Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF), and Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attacks. The Open Redirect vulnerability is due to the use of the getJSON function to load data from an external site. The Cross-Site Request Forgery vulnerability is due to the use of the .live() function to bind event handlers to elements, which can be exploited by an attacker to perform actions on behalf of the user. The Cross-Site Scripting vulnerability is due to the use of the .attr() function to get the value of an attribute, which can be manipulated by an attacker to inject malicious scripts.
